[File: vm-validator/src/vm_validator.rs] [Function: PooledVMValidator::notify_commit()] [Partial notification] If the loop at line 181 is interrupted (panic, thread kill), some validators may not receive the commit notification - can this cause permanent state divergence? (Critical)

[File: vm-validator/src/vm_validator.rs] [Function: PooledVMValidator::notify_commit()] [Lock hold time] Each lock at line 182 is held only for notify_commit() - but if notify_commit() involves expensive cache operations, can this block validations? (Low)

[File: vm-validator/src/vm_validator.rs] [Function: VMValidator::clone()] [State copy consistency] The clone at line 48-52 creates a new VMValidator with cloned db_reader - does the new instance get the same state version as the original, or could they diverge? (High)

[File: vm-validator/src/vm_validator.rs] [Function: VMValidator::clone()] [Cache duplication] When a VMValidator is cloned, is the CachedModuleView cache also cloned, leading to memory duplication, or is it shared? What are the security implications? (Low)

[File: vm-validator/src/vm_validator.rs] [Concurrency] [Mutex deadlock] Can calling restart() and validate_transaction() concurrently on the same PooledVMValidator cause deadlock due to lock acquisition ordering at lines 157, 175, 182? (High)

[File: vm-validator/src/vm_validator.rs] [Concurrency] [Data race] The VMValidator struct at line 43-46 contains CachedModuleView - is this type thread-safe, or can concurrent access through different Arc<Mutex<>> instances cause data races? (Critical)

[File: vm-validator/src/vm_validator.rs] [Concurrency] [Lock contention] With random VM selection at line 139-140, can many concurrent validations repeatedly select the same VM causing lock contention and validation delays? (Medium)

[File: vm-validator/src/vm_validator.rs] [Concurrency] [Mutex poisoning cascade] If one validator panics during validation at line 166 and poisons its mutex, can subsequent get_next_vm() calls select this validator causing more panics and poisoning the entire pool? (High)

[File: vm-validator/src/vm_validator.rs] [State consistency] [Version drift] Can validators in the pool end up at different state versions if notify_commit() is called while some are actively validating, causing inconsistent validation results across the pool? (Critical)

[File: vm-validator/src/vm_validator.rs] [State consistency] [Cache coherency] When one validator's cache is updated via notify_commit at line 182, are other validators' caches updated atomically, or can there be a window where validators see different module versions? (High)
